GV.title: GOVERN
GV.text: The organization's cybersecurity risk management strategy, expectations, and policy are established, communicated, and monitored

GV.OC.title: Organizational Context
GV.OC.text: The circumstances - mission, stakeholder expectations, dependencies, and legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements - surrounding the organization's cybersecurity risk management decisions are understood

GV.OC-01.text: The organizational mission is understood and informs cybersecurity risk management

GV.OC-01.001.title: Ex1
GV.OC-01.001.text: Share the organization's mission (e.g., through vision and mission statements, marketing, and service strategies) to provide a basis for identifying risks that may impede that mission

GV.OC-02.text: Internal and external stakeholders are understood, and their needs and expectations regarding cybersecurity risk management are understood and considered

GV.OC-02.002.title: Ex1
GV.OC-02.002.text: Identify relevant internal stakeholders and their cybersecurity-related expectations (e.g., performance and risk expectations of officers, directors, and advisors; cultural expectations of employees)

GV.OC-02.003.title: Ex2
GV.OC-02.003.text: Identify relevant external stakeholders and their cybersecurity-related expectations (e.g., privacy expectations of customers, business expectations of partnerships, compliance expectations of regulators, ethics expectations of society)

GV.OC-03.text: Legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements regarding cybersecurity - including privacy and civil liberties obligations - are understood and managed

GV.OC-03.004.title: Ex1
GV.OC-03.004.text: Determine a process to track and manage legal and regulatory requirements regarding protection of individuals' information (e.g., Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act, California Consumer Privacy Act, General Data Protection Regulation)

GV.OC-03.005.title: Ex2
GV.OC-03.005.text: Determine a process to track and manage contractual requirements for cybersecurity management of supplier, customer, and partner information

GV.OC-03.006.title: Ex3
GV.OC-03.006.text: Align the organization's cybersecurity strategy with legal, regulatory, and contractual requirements

GV.OC-04.text: Critical objectives, capabilities, and services that stakeholders depend on or expect from the organization are understood and communicated

GV.OC-04.007.title: Ex1
GV.OC-04.007.text: Establish criteria for determining the criticality of capabilities and services as viewed by internal and external stakeholders

GV.OC-04.008.title: Ex2
GV.OC-04.008.text: Determine (e.g., from a business impact analysis) assets and business operations that are vital to achieving mission objectives and the potential impact of a loss (or partial loss) of such operations

GV.OC-04.009.title: Ex3
GV.OC-04.009.text: Establish and communicate resilience objectives (e.g., recovery time objectives) for delivering critical capabilities and services in various operating states (e.g., under attack, during recovery, normal operation)

GV.OC-05.text: Outcomes, capabilities, and services that the organization depends on are understood and communicated

GV.OC-05.010.title: Ex1
GV.OC-05.010.text: Create an inventory of the organization's dependencies on external resources (e.g., facilities, cloud-based hosting providers) and their relationships to organizational assets and business functions

GV.OC-05.011.title: Ex2
GV.OC-05.011.text: Identify and document external dependencies that are potential points of failure for the organization's critical capabilities and services, and share that information with appropriate personnel

GV.RM.title: Risk Management Strategy
GV.RM.text: The organization's priorities, constraints, risk tolerance and appetite statements, and assumptions are established, communicated, and used to support operational risk decisions

GV.RM-01.text: Risk management objectives are established and agreed to by organizational stakeholders

GV.RM-01.012.title: Ex1
GV.RM-01.012.text: Update near-term and long-term cybersecurity risk management objectives as part of annual strategic planning and when major changes occur

GV.RM-01.013.title: Ex2
GV.RM-01.013.text: Establish measurable objectives for cybersecurity risk management (e.g., manage the quality of user training, ensure adequate risk protection for industrial control systems)

GV.RM-01.014.title: Ex3
GV.RM-01.014.text: Senior leaders agree about cybersecurity objectives and use them for measuring and managing risk and performance

GV.RM-02.text: Risk appetite and risk tolerance statements are established, communicated, and maintained

GV.RM-02.015.title: Ex1
GV.RM-02.015.text: Determine and communicate risk appetite statements that convey expectations about the appropriate level of risk for the organization

GV.RM-02.016.title: Ex2
GV.RM-02.016.text: Translate risk appetite statements into specific, measurable, and broadly understandable risk tolerance statements

GV.RM-02.017.title: Ex3
GV.RM-02.017.text: Refine organizational objectives and risk appetite periodically based on known risk exposure and residual risk

GV.RM-03.text: Cybersecurity risk management activities and outcomes are included in enterprise risk management processes

GV.RM-03.018.title: Ex1
GV.RM-03.018.text: Aggregate and manage cybersecurity risks alongside other enterprise risks (e.g., compliance, financial, operational, regulatory, reputational, safety)

GV.RM-03.019.title: Ex2
GV.RM-03.019.text: Include cybersecurity risk managers in enterprise risk management planning

GV.RM-03.020.title: Ex3
GV.RM-03.020.text: Establish criteria for escalating cybersecurity risks within enterprise risk management

GV.RM-04.text: Strategic direction that describes appropriate risk response options is established and communicated

GV.RM-04.021.title: Ex1
GV.RM-04.021.text: Specify criteria for accepting and avoiding cybersecurity risk for various classifications of data

GV.RM-04.022.title: Ex2
GV.RM-04.022.text: Determine whether to purchase cybersecurity insurance

GV.RM-04.023.title: Ex3
GV.RM-04.023.text: Document conditions under which shared responsibility models are acceptable (e.g., outsourcing certain cybersecurity functions, having a third party perform financial transactions on behalf of the organization, using public cloud-based services)

GV.RM-05.text: Lines of communication across the organization are established for cybersecurity risks, including risks from suppliers and other third parties

GV.RM-05.024.title: Ex1
GV.RM-05.024.text: Determine how to update senior executives, directors, and management on the organization's cybersecurity posture at agreed-upon intervals

GV.RM-05.025.title: Ex2
GV.RM-05.025.text: Identify how all departments across the organization - such as management, operations, internal auditors, legal, acquisition, physical security, and HR - will communicate with each other about cybersecurity risks

GV.RM-06.text: A standardized method for calculating, documenting, categorizing, and prioritizing cybersecurity risks is established and communicated

GV.RM-06.026.title: Ex1
GV.RM-06.026.text: Establish criteria for using a quantitative approach to cybersecurity risk analysis, and specify probability and exposure formulas

GV.RM-06.027.title: Ex2
GV.RM-06.027.text: Create and use templates (e.g., a risk register) to document cybersecurity risk information (e.g., risk description, exposure, treatment, and ownership)

GV.RM-06.028.title: Ex3
GV.RM-06.028.text: Establish criteria for risk prioritization at the appropriate levels within the enterprise

GV.RM-06.029.title: Ex4
GV.RM-06.029.text: Use a consistent list of risk categories to support integrating, aggregating, and comparing cybersecurity risks

GV.RM-07.text: Strategic opportunities (i.e., positive risks) are characterized and are included in organizational cybersecurity risk discussions

GV.RM-07.030.title: Ex1
GV.RM-07.030.text: Define and communicate guidance and methods for identifying opportunities and including them in risk discussions (e.g., strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats [SWOT] analysis)

GV.RM-07.031.title: Ex2
GV.RM-07.031.text: Identify stretch goals and document them

GV.RM-07.032.title: Ex3
GV.RM-07.032.text: Calculate, document, and prioritize positive risks alongside negative risks

GV.RR.title: Roles, Responsibilities, and Authorities
GV.RR.text: Cybersecurity roles, responsibilities, and authorities to foster accountability, performance assessment, and continuous improvement are established and communicated

GV.RR-01.text: Organizational leadership is responsible and accountable for cybersecurity risk and fosters a culture that is risk-aware, ethical, and continually improving

GV.RR-01.033.title: Ex1
GV.RR-01.033.text: Leaders (e.g., directors) agree on their roles and responsibilities in developing, implementing, and assessing the organization's cybersecurity strategy

GV.RR-01.034.title: Ex2
GV.RR-01.034.text: Share leaders' expectations regarding a secure and ethical culture, especially when current events present the opportunity to highlight positive or negative examples of cybersecurity risk management

GV.RR-01.035.title: Ex3
GV.RR-01.035.text: Leaders direct the CISO to maintain a comprehensive cybersecurity risk strategy and review and update it at least annually and after major events

GV.RR-01.036.title: Ex4
GV.RR-01.036.text: Conduct reviews to ensure adequate authority and coordination among those responsible for managing cybersecurity risk

GV.RR-02.text: Roles, responsibilities, and authorities related to cybersecurity risk management are established, communicated, understood, and enforced

GV.RR-02.037.title: Ex1
GV.RR-02.037.text: Document risk management roles and responsibilities in policy

GV.RR-02.038.title: Ex2
GV.RR-02.038.text: Document who is responsible and accountable for cybersecurity risk management activities and how those teams and individuals are to be consulted and informed

GV.RR-02.039.title: Ex3
GV.RR-02.039.text: Include cybersecurity responsibilities and performance requirements in personnel descriptions

GV.RR-02.040.title: Ex4
GV.RR-02.040.text: Document performance goals for personnel with cybersecurity risk management responsibilities, and periodically measure performance to identify areas for improvement

GV.RR-02.041.title: Ex5
GV.RR-02.041.text: Clearly articulate cybersecurity responsibilities within operations, risk functions, and internal audit functions

GV.RR-03.text: Adequate resources are allocated commensurate with the cybersecurity risk strategy, roles, responsibilities, and policies

GV.RR-03.042.title: Ex1
GV.RR-03.042.text: Conduct periodic management reviews to ensure that those given cybersecurity risk management responsibilities have the necessary authority

GV.RR-03.043.title: Ex2
GV.RR-03.043.text: Identify resource allocation and investment in line with risk tolerance and response

GV.RR-03.044.title: Ex3
GV.RR-03.044.text: Provide adequate and sufficient people, process, and technical resources to support the cybersecurity strategy

GV.RR-04.text: Cybersecurity is included in human resources practices

GV.RR-04.045.title: Ex1
GV.RR-04.045.text: Integrate cybersecurity risk management considerations into human resources processes (e.g., personnel screening, onboarding, change notification, offboarding)

GV.RR-04.046.title: Ex2
GV.RR-04.046.text: Consider cybersecurity knowledge to be a positive factor in hiring, training, and retention decisions

GV.RR-04.047.title: Ex3
GV.RR-04.047.text: Conduct background checks prior to onboarding new personnel for sensitive roles, and periodically repeat background checks for personnel with such roles

GV.RR-04.048.title: Ex4
GV.RR-04.048.text: Define and enforce obligations for personnel to be aware of, adhere to, and uphold security policies as they relate to their roles

GV.PO.title: Policy
GV.PO.text: Organizational cybersecurity policy is established, communicated, and enforced

GV.PO-01.text: Policy for managing cybersecurity risks is established based on organizational context, cybersecurity strategy, and priorities and is communicated and enforced

GV.PO-01.049.title: Ex1
GV.PO-01.049.text: Create, disseminate, and maintain an understandable, usable risk management policy with statements of management intent, expectations, and direction

GV.PO-01.050.title: Ex2
GV.PO-01.050.text: Periodically review policy and supporting processes and procedures to ensure that they align with risk management strategy objectives and priorities, as well as the high-level direction of the cybersecurity policy

GV.PO-01.051.title: Ex3
GV.PO-01.051.text: Require approval from senior management on policy

GV.PO-01.052.title: Ex4
GV.PO-01.052.text: Communicate cybersecurity risk management policy and supporting processes and procedures across the organization

GV.PO-01.053.title: Ex5
GV.PO-01.053.text: Require personnel to acknowledge receipt of policy when first hired, annually, and whenever policy is updated

GV.PO-02.text: Policy for managing cybersecurity risks is reviewed, updated, communicated, and enforced to reflect changes in requirements, threats, technology, and organizational mission

GV.PO-02.054.title: Ex1
GV.PO-02.054.text: Update policy based on periodic reviews of cybersecurity risk management results to ensure that policy and supporting processes and procedures adequately maintain risk at an acceptable level

GV.PO-02.055.title: Ex2
GV.PO-02.055.text: Provide a timeline for reviewing changes to the organization's risk environment (e.g., changes in risk or in the organization's mission objectives), and communicate recommended policy updates

GV.PO-02.056.title: Ex3
GV.PO-02.056.text: Update policy to reflect changes in legal and regulatory requirements

GV.PO-02.057.title: Ex4
GV.PO-02.057.text: Update policy to reflect changes in technology (e.g., adoption of artificial intelligence) and changes to the business (e.g., acquisition of a new business, new contract requirements)

GV.OV.title: Oversight
GV.OV.text: Results of organization-wide cybersecurity risk management activities and performance are used to inform, improve, and adjust the risk management strategy

GV.OV-01.text: Cybersecurity risk management strategy outcomes are reviewed to inform and adjust strategy and direction

GV.OV-01.058.title: Ex1
GV.OV-01.058.text: Measure how well the risk management strategy and risk results have helped leaders make decisions and achieve organizational objectives

GV.OV-01.059.title: Ex2
GV.OV-01.059.text: Examine whether cybersecurity risk strategies that impede operations or innovation should be adjusted

GV.OV-02.text: The cybersecurity risk management strategy is reviewed and adjusted to ensure coverage of organizational requirements and risks

GV.OV-02.060.title: Ex1
GV.OV-02.060.text: Review audit findings to confirm whether the existing cybersecurity strategy has ensured compliance with internal and external requirements

GV.OV-02.061.title: Ex2
GV.OV-02.061.text: Review the performance oversight of those in cybersecurity-related roles to determine whether policy changes are necessary

GV.OV-02.062.title: Ex3
GV.OV-02.062.text: Review strategy in light of cybersecurity incidents

GV.OV-03.text: Organizational cybersecurity risk management performance is evaluated and reviewed for adjustments needed

GV.OV-03.063.title: Ex1
GV.OV-03.063.text: Review key performance indicators (KPIs) to ensure that organization-wide policies and procedures achieve objectives

GV.OV-03.064.title: Ex2
GV.OV-03.064.text: Review key risk indicators (KRIs) to identify risks the organization faces, including likelihood and potential impact

GV.OV-03.065.title: Ex3
GV.OV-03.065.text: Collect and communicate metrics on cybersecurity risk management with senior leadership

GV.SC.title: Cybersecurity Supply Chain Risk Management
GV.SC.text: Cyber supply chain risk management processes are identified, established, managed, monitored, and improved by organizational stakeholders

GV.SC-01.text: A cybersecurity supply chain risk management program, strategy, objectives, policies, and processes are established and agreed to by organizational stakeholders

GV.SC-01.066.title: Ex1
GV.SC-01.066.text: Establish a strategy that expresses the objectives of the cybersecurity supply chain risk management program

GV.SC-01.067.title: Ex2
GV.SC-01.067.text: Develop the cybersecurity supply chain risk management program, including a plan (with milestones), policies, and procedures that guide implementation and improvement of the program, and share the policies and procedures with the organizational stakeholders

GV.SC-01.068.title: Ex3
GV.SC-01.068.text: Develop and implement program processes based on the strategy, objectives, policies, and procedures that are agreed upon and performed by the organizational stakeholders

GV.SC-01.069.title: Ex4
GV.SC-01.069.text: Establish a cross-organizational mechanism that ensures alignment between functions that contribute to cybersecurity supply chain risk management, such as cybersecurity, IT, operations, legal, human resources, and engineering

GV.SC-02.text: Cybersecurity roles and responsibilities for suppliers, customers, and partners are established, communicated, and coordinated internally and externally

GV.SC-02.070.title: Ex1
GV.SC-02.070.text: Identify one or more specific roles or positions that will be responsible and accountable for planning, resourcing, and executing cybersecurity supply chain risk management activities

GV.SC-02.071.title: Ex2
GV.SC-02.071.text: Document cybersecurity supply chain risk management roles and responsibilities in policy

GV.SC-02.072.title: Ex3
GV.SC-02.072.text: Create responsibility matrixes to document who will be responsible and accountable for cybersecurity supply chain risk management activities and how those teams and individuals will be consulted and informed

GV.SC-02.073.title: Ex4
GV.SC-02.073.text: Include cybersecurity supply chain risk management responsibilities and performance requirements in personnel descriptions to ensure clarity and improve accountability

GV.SC-02.074.title: Ex5
GV.SC-02.074.text: Document performance goals for personnel with cybersecurity risk management-specific responsibilities, and periodically measure them to demonstrate and improve performance

GV.SC-02.075.title: Ex6
GV.SC-02.075.text: Develop roles and responsibilities for suppliers, customers, and business partners to address shared responsibilities for applicable cybersecurity risks, and integrate them into organizational policies and applicable third-party agreements

GV.SC-02.076.title: Ex7
GV.SC-02.076.text: Internally communicate cybersecurity supply chain risk management roles and responsibilities for third parties

GV.SC-02.077.title: Ex8
GV.SC-02.077.text: Establish rules and protocols for information sharing and reporting processes between the organization and its suppliers

GV.SC-03.text: Cybersecurity supply chain risk management is integrated into cybersecurity and enterprise risk management, risk assessment, and improvement processes

GV.SC-03.078.title: Ex1
GV.SC-03.078.text: Identify areas of alignment and overlap with cybersecurity and enterprise risk management

GV.SC-03.079.title: Ex2
GV.SC-03.079.text: Establish integrated control sets for cybersecurity risk management and cybersecurity supply chain risk management

GV.SC-03.080.title: Ex3
GV.SC-03.080.text: Integrate cybersecurity supply chain risk management into improvement processes

GV.SC-03.081.title: Ex4
GV.SC-03.081.text: Escalate material cybersecurity risks in supply chains to senior management, and address them at the enterprise risk management level

GV.SC-04.text: Suppliers are known and prioritized by criticality

GV.SC-04.082.title: Ex1
GV.SC-04.082.text: Develop criteria for supplier criticality based on, for example, the sensitivity of data processed or possessed by suppliers, the degree of access to the organization's systems, and the importance of the products or services to the organization's mission

GV.SC-04.083.title: Ex2
GV.SC-04.083.text: Keep a record of all suppliers, and prioritize suppliers based on the criticality criteria

GV.SC-05.text: Requirements to address cybersecurity risks in supply chains are established, prioritized, and integrated into contracts and other types of agreements with suppliers and other relevant third parties

GV.SC-05.084.title: Ex1
GV.SC-05.084.text: Establish security requirements for suppliers, products, and services commensurate with their criticality level and potential impact if compromised

GV.SC-05.085.title: Ex2
GV.SC-05.085.text: Include all cybersecurity and supply chain requirements that third parties must follow and how compliance with the requirements may be verified in default contractual language

GV.SC-05.086.title: Ex3
GV.SC-05.086.text: Define the rules and protocols for information sharing between the organization and its suppliers and sub-tier suppliers in agreements

GV.SC-05.087.title: Ex4
GV.SC-05.087.text: Manage risk by including security requirements in agreements based on their criticality and potential impact if compromised

GV.SC-05.088.title: Ex5
GV.SC-05.088.text: Define security requirements in service-level agreements (SLAs) for monitoring suppliers for acceptable security performance throughout the supplier relationship lifecycle

GV.SC-05.089.title: Ex6
GV.SC-05.089.text: Contractually require suppliers to disclose cybersecurity features, functions, and vulnerabilities of their products and services for the life of the product or the term of service

GV.SC-05.090.title: Ex7
GV.SC-05.090.text: Contractually require suppliers to provide and maintain a current component inventory (e.g., software or hardware bill of materials) for critical products

GV.SC-05.091.title: Ex8
GV.SC-05.091.text: Contractually require suppliers to vet their employees and guard against insider threats

GV.SC-05.092.title: Ex9
GV.SC-05.092.text: Contractually require suppliers to provide evidence of performing acceptable security practices through, for example, self-attestation, conformance to known standards, certifications, or inspections

GV.SC-05.093.title: Ex10
GV.SC-05.093.text: Specify in contracts and other agreements the rights and responsibilities of the organization, its suppliers, and their supply chains, with respect to potential cybersecurity risks

GV.SC-06.text: Planning and due diligence are performed to reduce risks before entering into formal supplier or other third-party relationships

GV.SC-06.094.title: Ex1
GV.SC-06.094.text: Perform thorough due diligence on prospective suppliers that is consistent with procurement planning and commensurate with the level of risk, criticality, and complexity of each supplier relationship

GV.SC-06.095.title: Ex2
GV.SC-06.095.text: Assess the suitability of the technology and cybersecurity capabilities and the risk management practices of prospective suppliers

GV.SC-06.096.title: Ex3
GV.SC-06.096.text: Conduct supplier risk assessments against business and applicable cybersecurity requirements

GV.SC-06.097.title: Ex4
GV.SC-06.097.text: Assess the authenticity, integrity, and security of critical products prior to acquisition and use

GV.SC-07.text: The risks posed by a supplier, their products and services, and other third parties are understood, recorded, prioritized, assessed, responded to, and monitored over the course of the relationship

GV.SC-07.098.title: Ex1
GV.SC-07.098.text: Adjust assessment formats and frequencies based on the third party's reputation and the criticality of the products or services they provide

GV.SC-07.099.title: Ex2
GV.SC-07.099.text: Evaluate third parties' evidence of compliance with contractual cybersecurity requirements, such as self-attestations, warranties, certifications, and other artifacts

GV.SC-07.100.title: Ex3
GV.SC-07.100.text: Monitor critical suppliers to ensure that they are fulfilling their security obligations throughout the supplier relationship lifecycle using a variety of methods and techniques, such as inspections, audits, tests, or other forms of evaluation

GV.SC-07.101.title: Ex4
GV.SC-07.101.text: Monitor critical suppliers, services, and products for changes to their risk profiles, and reevaluate supplier criticality and risk impact accordingly

GV.SC-07.102.title: Ex5
GV.SC-07.102.text: Plan for unexpected supplier and supply chain-related interruptions to ensure business continuity

GV.SC-08.text: Relevant suppliers and other third parties are included in incident planning, response, and recovery activities

GV.SC-08.103.title: Ex1
GV.SC-08.103.text: Define and use rules and protocols for reporting incident response and recovery activities and the status between the organization and its suppliers

GV.SC-08.104.title: Ex2
GV.SC-08.104.text: Identify and document the roles and responsibilities of the organization and its suppliers for incident response

GV.SC-08.105.title: Ex3
GV.SC-08.105.text: Include critical suppliers in incident response exercises and simulations

GV.SC-08.106.title: Ex4
GV.SC-08.106.text: Define and coordinate crisis communication methods and protocols between the organization and its critical suppliers

GV.SC-08.107.title: Ex5
GV.SC-08.107.text: Conduct collaborative lessons learned sessions with critical suppliers

GV.SC-09.text: Supply chain security practices are integrated into cybersecurity and enterprise risk management programs, and their performance is monitored throughout the technology product and service life cycle

GV.SC-09.108.title: Ex1
GV.SC-09.108.text: Policies and procedures require provenance records for all acquired technology products and services

GV.SC-09.109.title: Ex2
GV.SC-09.109.text: Periodically provide risk reporting to leaders about how acquired components are proven to be untampered and authentic

GV.SC-09.110.title: Ex3
GV.SC-09.110.text: Communicate regularly among cybersecurity risk managers and operations personnel about the need to acquire software patches, updates, and upgrades only from authenticated and trustworthy software providers

GV.SC-09.111.title: Ex4
GV.SC-09.111.text: Review policies to ensure that they require approved supplier personnel to perform maintenance on supplier products

GV.SC-09.112.title: Ex5
GV.SC-09.112.text: Policies and procedure require checking upgrades to critical hardware for unauthorized changes

GV.SC-10.text: Cybersecurity supply chain risk management plans include provisions for activities that occur after the conclusion of a partnership or service agreement

GV.SC-10.113.title: Ex1
GV.SC-10.113.text: Establish processes for terminating critical relationships under both normal and adverse circumstances

GV.SC-10.114.title: Ex2
GV.SC-10.114.text: Define and implement plans for component end-of-life maintenance support and obsolescence

GV.SC-10.115.title: Ex3
GV.SC-10.115.text: Verify that supplier access to organization resources is deactivated promptly when it is no longer needed

GV.SC-10.116.title: Ex4
GV.SC-10.116.text: Verify that assets containing the organization's data are returned or properly disposed of in a timely, controlled, and safe manner

GV.SC-10.117.title: Ex5
GV.SC-10.117.text: Develop and execute a plan for terminating or transitioning supplier relationships that takes supply chain security risk and resiliency into account

GV.SC-10.118.title: Ex6
GV.SC-10.118.text: Mitigate risks to data and systems created by supplier termination

GV.SC-10.119.title: Ex7
GV.SC-10.119.text: Manage data leakage risks associated with supplier termination

ID.title: IDENTIFY
ID.text: The organization's current cybersecurity risks are understood

ID.AM.title: Asset Management
ID.AM.text: Assets (e.g., data, hardware, software, systems, facilities, services, people) that enable the organization to achieve business purposes are identified and managed consistent with their relative importance to organizational objectives and the organization's risk strategy

ID.AM-01.text: Inventories of hardware managed by the organization are maintained

ID.AM-01.120.title: Ex1
ID.AM-01.120.text: Maintain inventories for all types of hardware, including IT, IoT, OT, and mobile devices

ID.AM-01.121.title: Ex2
ID.AM-01.121.text: Constantly monitor networks to detect new hardware and automatically update inventories

ID.AM-02.text: Inventories of software, services, and systems managed by the organization are maintained

ID.AM-02.122.title: Ex1
ID.AM-02.122.text: Maintain inventories for all types of software and services, including commercial-off-the-shelf, open-source, custom applications, API services, and cloud-based applications and services

ID.AM-02.123.title: Ex2
ID.AM-02.123.text: Constantly monitor all platforms, including containers and virtual machines, for software and service inventory changes

ID.AM-02.124.title: Ex3
ID.AM-02.124.text: Maintain an inventory of the organization's systems

ID.AM-03.text: Representations of the organization's authorized network communication and internal and external network data flows are maintained

ID.AM-03.125.title: Ex1
ID.AM-03.125.text: Maintain baselines of communication and data flows within the organization's wired and wireless networks

ID.AM-03.126.title: Ex2
ID.AM-03.126.text: Maintain baselines of communication and data flows between the organization and third parties

ID.AM-03.127.title: Ex3
ID.AM-03.127.text: Maintain baselines of communication and data flows for the organization's infrastructure-as-a-service (IaaS) usage

ID.AM-03.128.title: Ex4
ID.AM-03.128.text: Maintain documentation of expected network ports, protocols, and services that are typically used among authorized systems

ID.AM-04.text: Inventories of services provided by suppliers are maintained

ID.AM-04.129.title: Ex1
ID.AM-04.129.text: Inventory all external services used by the organization, including third-party infrastructure-as-a-service (IaaS), platform-as-a-service (PaaS), and software-as-a-service (SaaS) offerings; APIs; and other externally hosted application services

ID.AM-04.130.title: Ex2
ID.AM-04.130.text: Update the inventory when a new external service is going to be utilized to ensure adequate cybersecurity risk management monitoring of the organization's use of that service

ID.AM-05.text: Assets are prioritized based on classification, criticality, resources, and impact on the mission

ID.AM-05.131.title: Ex1
ID.AM-05.131.text: Define criteria for prioritizing each class of assets

ID.AM-05.132.title: Ex2
ID.AM-05.132.text: Apply the prioritization criteria to assets

ID.AM-05.133.title: Ex3
ID.AM-05.133.text: Track the asset priorities and update them periodically or when significant changes to the organization occur

ID.AM-07.text: Inventories of data and corresponding metadata for designated data types are maintained

ID.AM-07.134.title: Ex1
ID.AM-07.134.text: Maintain a list of the designated data types of interest (e.g., personally identifiable information, protected health information, financial account numbers, organization intellectual property, operational technology data)

ID.AM-07.135.title: Ex2
ID.AM-07.135.text: Continuously discover and analyze ad hoc data to identify new instances of designated data types

ID.AM-07.136.title: Ex3
ID.AM-07.136.text: Assign data classifications to designated data types through tags or labels

ID.AM-07.137.title: Ex4
ID.AM-07.137.text: Track the provenance, data owner, and geolocation of each instance of designated data types

ID.AM-08.text: Systems, hardware, software, services, and data are managed throughout their life cycles

ID.AM-08.138.title: Ex1
ID.AM-08.138.text: Integrate cybersecurity considerations throughout the life cycles of systems, hardware, software, and services

ID.AM-08.139.title: Ex2
ID.AM-08.139.text: Integrate cybersecurity considerations into product life cycles

ID.AM-08.140.title: Ex3
ID.AM-08.140.text: Identify unofficial uses of technology to meet mission objectives (i.e., shadow IT)

ID.AM-08.141.title: Ex4
ID.AM-08.141.text: Periodically identify redundant systems, hardware, software, and services that unnecessarily increase the organization's attack surface

ID.AM-08.142.title: Ex5
ID.AM-08.142.text: Properly configure and secure systems, hardware, software, and services prior to their deployment in production

ID.AM-08.143.title: Ex6
ID.AM-08.143.text: Update inventories when systems, hardware, software, and services are moved or transferred within the organization

ID.AM-08.144.title: Ex7
ID.AM-08.144.text: Securely destroy stored data based on the organization's data retention policy using the prescribed destruction method, and keep and manage a record of the destructions

ID.AM-08.145.title: Ex8
ID.AM-08.145.text: Securely sanitize data storage when hardware is being retired, decommissioned, reassigned, or sent for repairs or replacement

ID.AM-08.146.title: Ex9
ID.AM-08.146.text: Offer methods for destroying paper, storage media, and other physical forms of data storage

ID.RA.title: Risk Assessment
ID.RA.text: The cybersecurity risk to the organization, assets, and individuals is understood by the organization

ID.RA-01.text: Vulnerabilities in assets are identified, validated, and recorded

ID.RA-01.147.title: Ex1
ID.RA-01.147.text: Use vulnerability management technologies to identify unpatched and misconfigured software

ID.RA-01.148.title: Ex2
ID.RA-01.148.text: Assess network and system architectures for design and implementation weaknesses that affect cybersecurity

ID.RA-01.149.title: Ex3
ID.RA-01.149.text: Review, analyze, or test organization-developed software to identify design, coding, and default configuration vulnerabilities

ID.RA-01.150.title: Ex4
ID.RA-01.150.text: Assess facilities that house critical computing assets for physical vulnerabilities and resilience issues

ID.RA-01.151.title: Ex5
ID.RA-01.151.text: Monitor sources of cyber threat intelligence for information on new vulnerabilities in products and services

ID.RA-01.152.title: Ex6
ID.RA-01.152.text: Review processes and procedures for weaknesses that could be exploited to affect cybersecurity

ID.RA-02.text: Cyber threat intelligence is received from information sharing forums and sources

ID.RA-02.153.title: Ex1
ID.RA-02.153.text: Configure cybersecurity tools and technologies with detection or response capabilities to securely ingest cyber threat intelligence feeds

ID.RA-02.154.title: Ex2
ID.RA-02.154.text: Receive and review advisories from reputable third parties on current threat actors and their tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs)

ID.RA-02.155.title: Ex3
ID.RA-02.155.text: Monitor sources of cyber threat intelligence for information on the types of vulnerabilities that emerging technologies may have

ID.RA-03.text: Internal and external threats to the organization are identified and recorded

ID.RA-03.156.title: Ex1
ID.RA-03.156.text: Use cyber threat intelligence to maintain awareness of the types of threat actors likely to target the organization and the TTPs they are likely to use

ID.RA-03.157.title: Ex2
ID.RA-03.157.text: Perform threat hunting to look for signs of threat actors within the environment

ID.RA-03.158.title: Ex3
ID.RA-03.158.text: Implement processes for identifying internal threat actors

ID.RA-04.text: Potential impacts and likelihoods of threats exploiting vulnerabilities are identified and recorded

ID.RA-04.159.title: Ex1
ID.RA-04.159.text: Business leaders and cybersecurity risk management practitioners work together to estimate the likelihood and impact of risk scenarios and record them in risk registers

ID.RA-04.160.title: Ex2
ID.RA-04.160.text: Enumerate the potential business impacts of unauthorized access to the organization's communications, systems, and data processed in or by those systems

ID.RA-04.161.title: Ex3
ID.RA-04.161.text: Account for the potential impacts of cascading failures for systems of systems

ID.RA-05.text: Threats, vulnerabilities, likelihoods, and impacts are used to understand inherent risk and inform risk response prioritization

ID.RA-05.162.title: Ex1
ID.RA-05.162.text: Develop threat models to better understand risks to the data and identify appropriate risk responses

ID.RA-05.163.title: Ex2
ID.RA-05.163.text: Prioritize cybersecurity resource allocations and investments based on estimated likelihoods and impacts

ID.RA-06.text: Risk responses are chosen, prioritized, planned, tracked, and communicated

ID.RA-06.164.title: Ex1
ID.RA-06.164.text: Apply the vulnerability management plan's criteria for deciding whether to accept, transfer, mitigate, or avoid risk

ID.RA-06.165.title: Ex2
ID.RA-06.165.text: Apply the vulnerability management plan's criteria for selecting compensating controls to mitigate risk

ID.RA-06.166.title: Ex3
ID.RA-06.166.text: Track the progress of risk response implementation (e.g., plan of action and milestones [POA&M], risk register, risk detail report)

ID.RA-06.167.title: Ex4
ID.RA-06.167.text: Use risk assessment findings to inform risk response decisions and actions

ID.RA-06.168.title: Ex5
ID.RA-06.168.text: Communicate planned risk responses to affected stakeholders in priority order

ID.RA-07.text: Changes and exceptions are managed, assessed for risk impact, recorded, and tracked

ID.RA-07.169.title: Ex1
ID.RA-07.169.text: Implement and follow procedures for the formal documentation, review, testing, and approval of proposed changes and requested exceptions

ID.RA-07.170.title: Ex2
ID.RA-07.170.text: Document the possible risks of making or not making each proposed change, and provide guidance on rolling back changes

ID.RA-07.171.title: Ex3
ID.RA-07.171.text: Document the risks related to each requested exception and the plan for responding to those risks

ID.RA-07.172.title: Ex4
ID.RA-07.172.text: Periodically review risks that were accepted based upon planned future actions or milestones

ID.RA-08.text: Processes for receiving, analyzing, and responding to vulnerability disclosures are established

ID.RA-08.173.title: Ex1
ID.RA-08.173.text: Conduct vulnerability information sharing between the organization and its suppliers following the rules and protocols defined in contracts

ID.RA-08.174.title: Ex2
ID.RA-08.174.text: Assign responsibilities and verify the execution of procedures for processing, analyzing the impact of, and responding to cybersecurity threat, vulnerability, or incident disclosures by suppliers, customers, partners, and government cybersecurity organizations

ID.RA-09.text: The authenticity and integrity of hardware and software are assessed prior to acquisition and use

ID.RA-09.175.title: Ex1
ID.RA-09.175.text: Assess the authenticity and cybersecurity of critical technology products and services prior to acquisition and use

ID.RA-10.text: Critical suppliers are assessed prior to acquisition

ID.RA-10.176.title: Ex1
ID.RA-10.176.text: Conduct supplier risk assessments against business and applicable cybersecurity requirements, including the supply chain

ID.IM.title: Improvement
ID.IM.text: Improvements to organizational cybersecurity risk management processes, procedures and activities are identified across all CSF Functions

ID.IM-01.177.title: Ex1
ID.IM-01.177.text: Perform self-assessments of critical services that take current threats and TTPs into consideration

ID.IM-01.178.title: Ex2
ID.IM-01.178.text: Invest in third-party assessments or independent audits of the effectiveness of the organization's cybersecurity program to identify areas that need improvement

ID.IM-01.179.title: Ex3
ID.IM-01.179.text: Constantly evaluate compliance with selected cybersecurity requirements through automated means

ID.IM-02.text: Improvements are identified from security tests and exercises, including those done in coordination with suppliers and relevant third parties

ID.IM-02.180.title: Ex1
ID.IM-02.180.text: Identify improvements for future incident response activities based on findings from incident response assessments (e.g., tabletop exercises and simulations, tests, internal reviews, independent audits)

ID.IM-02.181.title: Ex2
ID.IM-02.181.text: Identify improvements for future business continuity, disaster recovery, and incident response activities based on exercises performed in coordination with critical service providers and product suppliers

ID.IM-02.182.title: Ex3
ID.IM-02.182.text: Involve internal stakeholders (e.g., senior executives, legal department, HR) in security tests and exercises as appropriate

ID.IM-02.183.title: Ex4
ID.IM-02.183.text: Perform penetration testing to identify opportunities to improve the security posture of selected high-risk systems as approved by leadership

ID.IM-02.184.title: Ex5
ID.IM-02.184.text: Exercise contingency plans for responding to and recovering from the discovery that products or services did not originate with the contracted supplier or partner or were altered before receipt

ID.IM-02.185.title: Ex6
ID.IM-02.185.text: Collect and analyze performance metrics using security tools and services to inform improvements to the cybersecurity program

ID.IM-03.text: Improvements are identified from execution of operational processes, procedures, and activities

ID.IM-03.186.title: Ex1
ID.IM-03.186.text: Conduct collaborative lessons learned sessions with suppliers

ID.IM-03.187.title: Ex2
ID.IM-03.187.text: Annually review cybersecurity policies, processes, and procedures to take lessons learned into account

ID.IM-03.188.title: Ex3
ID.IM-03.188.text: Use metrics to assess operational cybersecurity performance over time

ID.IM-04.text: Incident response plans and other cybersecurity plans that affect operations are established, communicated, maintained, and improved

ID.IM-04.189.title: Ex1
ID.IM-04.189.text: Establish contingency plans (e.g., incident response, business continuity, disaster recovery) for responding to and recovering from adverse events that can interfere with operations, expose confidential information, or otherwise endanger the organization's mission and viability

ID.IM-04.190.title: Ex2
ID.IM-04.190.text: Include contact and communication information, processes for handling common scenarios, and criteria for prioritization, escalation, and elevation in all contingency plans

ID.IM-04.191.title: Ex3
ID.IM-04.191.text: Create a vulnerability management plan to identify and assess all types of vulnerabilities and to prioritize, test, and implement risk responses

ID.IM-04.192.title: Ex4
ID.IM-04.192.text: Communicate cybersecurity plans (including updates) to those responsible for carrying them out and to affected parties

ID.IM-04.193.title: Ex5
ID.IM-04.193.text: Review and update all cybersecurity plans annually or when a need for significant improvements is identified

PR.title: PROTECT
PR.text: Safeguards to manage the organization's cybersecurity risks are used

PR.AA.title: Identity Management, Authentication, and Access Control
PR.AA.text: Access to physical and logical assets is limited to authorized users, services, and hardware and  managed commensurate with the assessed risk of unauthorized access

PR.AA-01.text: Identities and credentials for authorized users, services, and hardware are managed by the organization

PR.AA-01.194.title: Ex1
PR.AA-01.194.text: Initiate requests for new access or additional access for employees, contractors, and others, and track, review, and fulfill the requests, with permission from system or data owners when needed

PR.AA-01.195.title: Ex2
PR.AA-01.195.text: Issue, manage, and revoke cryptographic certificates and identity tokens, cryptographic keys (i.e., key management), and other credentials

PR.AA-01.196.title: Ex3
PR.AA-01.196.text: Select a unique identifier for each device from immutable hardware characteristics or an identifier securely provisioned to the device

PR.AA-01.197.title: Ex4
PR.AA-01.197.text: Physically label authorized hardware with an identifier for inventory and servicing purposes

PR.AA-02.text: Identities are proofed and bound to credentials based on the context of interactions

PR.AA-02.198.title: Ex1
PR.AA-02.198.text: Verify a person's claimed identity at enrollment time using government-issued identity credentials (e.g., passport, visa, driver's license)

PR.AA-02.199.title: Ex2
PR.AA-02.199.text: Issue a different credential for each person (i.e., no credential sharing)

PR.AA-03.text: Users, services, and hardware are authenticated

PR.AA-03.201.title: Ex2
PR.AA-03.201.text: Enforce policies for the minimum strength of passwords, PINs, and similar authenticators

PR.AA-03.202.title: Ex3
PR.AA-03.202.text: Periodically reauthenticate users, services, and hardware based on risk (e.g., in zero trust architectures)

PR.AA-03.203.title: Ex4
PR.AA-03.203.text: Ensure that authorized personnel can access accounts essential for protecting safety under emergency conditions

PR.AA-04.text: Identity assertions are protected, conveyed, and verified

PR.AA-04.204.title: Ex1
PR.AA-04.204.text: Protect identity assertions that are used to convey authentication and user information through single sign-on systems

PR.AA-04.205.title: Ex2
PR.AA-04.205.text: Protect identity assertions that are used to convey authentication and user information between federated systems

PR.AA-04.206.title: Ex3
PR.AA-04.206.text: Implement standards-based approaches for identity assertions in all contexts, and follow all guidance for the generation (e.g., data models, metadata), protection (e.g., digital signing, encryption), and verification (e.g., signature validation) of identity assertions

PR.AA-05.text: Access permissions, entitlements, and authorizations are defined in a policy, managed, enforced, and reviewed, and incorporate the principles of least privilege and separation of duties

PR.AA-05.207.title: Ex1
PR.AA-05.207.text: Review logical and physical access privileges periodically and whenever someone changes roles or leaves the organization, and promptly rescind privileges that are no longer needed

PR.AA-05.208.title: Ex2
PR.AA-05.208.text: Take attributes of the requester and the requested resource into account for authorization decisions (e.g., geolocation, day/time, requester endpoint's cyber health)

PR.AA-05.209.title: Ex3
PR.AA-05.209.text: Restrict access and privileges to the minimum necessary (e.g., zero trust architecture)

PR.AA-05.210.title: Ex4
PR.AA-05.210.text: Periodically review the privileges associated with critical business functions to confirm proper separation of duties

PR.AA-06.text: Physical access to assets is managed, monitored, and enforced commensurate with risk

PR.AA-06.211.title: Ex1
PR.AA-06.211.text: Use security guards, security cameras, locked entrances, alarm systems, and other physical controls to monitor facilities and restrict access

PR.AA-06.212.title: Ex2
PR.AA-06.212.text: Employ additional physical security controls for areas that contain high-risk assets

PR.AA-06.213.title: Ex3
PR.AA-06.213.text: Escort guests, vendors, and other third parties within areas that contain business-critical assets

PR.AT.title: Awareness and Training
PR.AT.text: The organization's personnel are provided with cybersecurity awareness and training so that they can perform their cybersecurity-related tasks

PR.AT-01.text: Personnel are provided with awareness and training so that they possess the knowledge and skills to perform general tasks with cybersecurity risks in mind

PR.AT-01.214.title: Ex1
PR.AT-01.214.text: Provide basic cybersecurity awareness and training to employees, contractors, partners, suppliers, and all other users of the organization's non-public resources

PR.AT-01.215.title: Ex2
PR.AT-01.215.text: Train personnel to recognize social engineering attempts and other common attacks, report attacks and suspicious activity, comply with acceptable use policies, and perform basic cyber hygiene tasks (e.g., patching software, choosing passwords, protecting credentials)

PR.AT-01.216.title: Ex3
PR.AT-01.216.text: Explain the consequences of cybersecurity policy violations, both to individual users and the organization as a whole

PR.AT-01.217.title: Ex4
PR.AT-01.217.text: Periodically assess or test users on their understanding of basic cybersecurity practices

PR.AT-01.218.title: Ex5
PR.AT-01.218.text: Require annual refreshers to reinforce existing practices and introduce new practices

PR.AT-02.text: Individuals in specialized roles are provided with awareness and training so that they possess the knowledge and skills to perform relevant tasks with cybersecurity risks in mind

PR.AT-02.219.title: Ex1
PR.AT-02.219.text: Identify the specialized roles within the organization that require additional cybersecurity training, such as physical and cybersecurity personnel, finance personnel, senior leadership, and anyone with access to business-critical data

PR.AT-02.220.title: Ex2
PR.AT-02.220.text: Provide role-based cybersecurity awareness and training to all those in specialized roles, including contractors, partners, suppliers, and other third parties

PR.AT-02.221.title: Ex3
PR.AT-02.221.text: Periodically assess or test users on their understanding of cybersecurity practices for their specialized roles

PR.AT-02.222.title: Ex4
PR.AT-02.222.text: Require annual refreshers to reinforce existing practices and introduce new practices

PR.DS.title: Data Security
PR.DS.text: Data are managed consistent with the organization's risk strategy to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information

PR.DS-01.text: The confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data-at-rest are protected

PR.DS-01.223.title: Ex1
PR.DS-01.223.text: Use encryption, digital signatures, and cryptographic hashes to protect the confidentiality and integrity of stored data in files, databases, virtual machine disk images, container images, and other resources

PR.DS-01.224.title: Ex2
PR.DS-01.224.text: Use full disk encryption to protect data stored on user endpoints

PR.DS-01.225.title: Ex3
PR.DS-01.225.text: Confirm the integrity of software by validating signatures

PR.DS-01.226.title: Ex4
PR.DS-01.226.text: Restrict the use of removable media to prevent data exfiltration

PR.DS-01.227.title: Ex5
PR.DS-01.227.text: Physically secure removable media containing unencrypted sensitive information, such as within locked offices or file cabinets

PR.DS-02.text: The confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data-in-transit are protected

PR.DS-02.228.title: Ex1
PR.DS-02.228.text: Use encryption, digital signatures, and cryptographic hashes to protect the confidentiality and integrity of network communications

PR.DS-02.229.title: Ex2
PR.DS-02.229.text: Automatically encrypt or block outbound emails and other communications that contain sensitive data, depending on the data classification

PR.DS-02.230.title: Ex3
PR.DS-02.230.text: Block access to personal email, file sharing, file storage services, and other personal communications applications and services from organizational systems and networks

PR.DS-02.231.title: Ex4
PR.DS-02.231.text: Prevent reuse of sensitive data from production environments (e.g., customer records) in development, testing, and other non-production environments

PR.DS-10.text: The confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data-in-use are protected

PR.DS-10.232.title: Ex1
PR.DS-10.232.text: Remove data that must remain confidential (e.g., from processors and memory) as soon as it is no longer needed

PR.DS-10.233.title: Ex2
PR.DS-10.233.text: Protect data in use from access by other users and processes of the same platform

PR.DS-11.text: Backups of data are created, protected, maintained, and tested

PR.DS-11.234.title: Ex1
PR.DS-11.234.text: Continuously back up critical data in near-real-time, and back up other data frequently at agreed-upon schedules

PR.DS-11.235.title: Ex2
PR.DS-11.235.text: Test backups and restores for all types of data sources at least annually

PR.DS-11.236.title: Ex3
PR.DS-11.236.text: Securely store some backups offline and offsite so that an incident or disaster will not damage them

PR.DS-11.237.title: Ex4
PR.DS-11.237.text: Enforce geographic separation and geolocation restrictions for data backup storage

PR.PS.title: Platform Security
PR.PS.text: The hardware, software (e.g., firmware, operating systems, applications), and services of physical and virtual platforms are managed consistent with the organization's risk strategy to protect their confidentiality, integrity, and availability

PR.PS-01.text: Configuration management practices are established and applied

PR.PS-01.238.title: Ex1
PR.PS-01.238.text: Establish, test, deploy, and maintain hardened baselines that enforce the organization's cybersecurity policies and provide only essential capabilities (i.e., principle of least functionality)

PR.PS-01.239.title: Ex2
PR.PS-01.239.text: Review all default configuration settings that may potentially impact cybersecurity when installing or upgrading software

PR.PS-01.240.title: Ex3
PR.PS-01.240.text: Monitor implemented software for deviations from approved baselines

PR.PS-02.text: Software is maintained, replaced, and removed commensurate with risk

PR.PS-02.241.title: Ex1
PR.PS-02.241.text: Perform routine and emergency patching within the timeframes specified in the vulnerability management plan

PR.PS-02.242.title: Ex2
PR.PS-02.242.text: Update container images, and deploy new container instances to replace rather than update existing instances

PR.PS-02.243.title: Ex3
PR.PS-02.243.text: Replace end-of-life software and service versions with supported, maintained versions

PR.PS-02.244.title: Ex4
PR.PS-02.244.text: Uninstall and remove unauthorized software and services that pose undue risks

PR.PS-02.245.title: Ex5
PR.PS-02.245.text: Uninstall and remove any unnecessary software components (e.g., operating system utilities) that attackers might misuse

PR.PS-02.246.title: Ex6
PR.PS-02.246.text: Define and implement plans for software and service end-of-life maintenance support and obsolescence

PR.PS-03.text: Hardware is maintained, replaced, and removed commensurate with risk

PR.PS-03.247.title: Ex1
PR.PS-03.247.text: Replace hardware when it lacks needed security capabilities or when it cannot support software with needed security capabilities

PR.PS-03.248.title: Ex2
PR.PS-03.248.text: Define and implement plans for hardware end-of-life maintenance support and obsolescence

PR.PS-03.249.title: Ex3
PR.PS-03.249.text: Perform hardware disposal in a secure, responsible, and auditable manner

PR.PS-04.text: Log records are generated and made available for continuous monitoring

PR.PS-04.250.title: Ex1
PR.PS-04.250.text: Configure all operating systems, applications, and services (including cloud-based services) to generate log records

PR.PS-04.251.title: Ex2
PR.PS-04.251.text: Configure log generators to securely share their logs with the organization's logging infrastructure systems and services

PR.PS-04.252.title: Ex3
PR.PS-04.252.text: Configure log generators to record the data needed by zero-trust architectures

PR.PS-05.text: Installation and execution of unauthorized software are prevented

PR.PS-05.253.title: Ex1
PR.PS-05.253.text: When risk warrants it, restrict software execution to permitted products only or deny the execution of prohibited and unauthorized software

PR.PS-05.254.title: Ex2
PR.PS-05.254.text: Verify the source of new software and the software's integrity before installing it

PR.PS-05.255.title: Ex3
PR.PS-05.255.text: Configure platforms to use only approved DNS services that block access to known malicious domains

PR.PS-05.256.title: Ex4
PR.PS-05.256.text: Configure platforms to allow the installation of organization-approved software only

PR.PS-06.text: Secure software development practices are integrated, and their performance is monitored throughout the software development life cycle

PR.PS-06.257.title: Ex1
PR.PS-06.257.text: Protect all components of organization-developed software from tampering and unauthorized access

PR.PS-06.258.title: Ex2
PR.PS-06.258.text: Secure all software produced by the organization, with minimal vulnerabilities in their releases

PR.PS-06.259.title: Ex3
PR.PS-06.259.text: Maintain the software used in production environments, and securely dispose of software once it is no longer needed

PR.IR.title: Technology Infrastructure Resilience
PR.IR.text: Security architectures are managed with the organization's risk strategy to protect asset confidentiality, integrity, and availability, and organizational resilience

PR.IR-01.text: Networks and environments are protected from unauthorized logical access and usage

PR.IR-01.260.title: Ex1
PR.IR-01.260.text: Logically segment organization networks and cloud-based platforms according to trust boundaries and platform types (e.g., IT, IoT, OT, mobile, guests), and permit required communications only between segments

PR.IR-01.261.title: Ex2
PR.IR-01.261.text: Logically segment organization networks from external networks, and permit only necessary communications to enter the organization's networks from the external networks

PR.IR-01.262.title: Ex3
PR.IR-01.262.text: Implement zero trust architectures to restrict network access to each resource to the minimum necessary

PR.IR-01.263.title: Ex4
PR.IR-01.263.text: Check the cyber health of endpoints before allowing them to access and use production resources

PR.IR-02.text: The organization's technology assets are protected from environmental threats

PR.IR-02.264.title: Ex1
PR.IR-02.264.text: Protect organizational equipment from known environmental threats, such as flooding, fire, wind, and excessive heat and humidity

PR.IR-02.265.title: Ex2
PR.IR-02.265.text: Include protection from environmental threats and provisions for adequate operating infrastructure in requirements for service providers that operate systems on the organization's behalf

PR.IR-03.text: Mechanisms are implemented to achieve resilience requirements in normal and adverse situations

PR.IR-03.266.title: Ex1
PR.IR-03.266.text: Avoid single points of failure in systems and infrastructure

PR.IR-03.267.title: Ex2
PR.IR-03.267.text: Use load balancing to increase capacity and improve reliability

PR.IR-03.268.title: Ex3
PR.IR-03.268.text: Use high-availability components like redundant storage and power supplies to improve system reliability

PR.IR-04.text: Adequate resource capacity to ensure availability is maintained

PR.IR-04.269.title: Ex1
PR.IR-04.269.text: Monitor usage of storage, power, compute, network bandwidth, and other resources

PR.IR-04.270.title: Ex2
PR.IR-04.270.text: Forecast future needs, and scale resources accordingly

DE.title: DETECT
DE.text: Possible cybersecurity attacks and compromises are found and analyzed

DE.AE.title: Adverse Event Analysis
DE.AE.text: Anomalies, indicators of compromise, and other potentially adverse events are analyzed to characterize the events and detect cybersecurity incidents

DE.AE-02.text: Potentially adverse events are analyzed to better understand associated activities

DE.AE-02.290.title: Ex1
DE.AE-02.290.text: Use security information and event management (SIEM) or other tools to continuously monitor log events for known malicious and suspicious activity

DE.AE-02.291.title: Ex2
DE.AE-02.291.text: Utilize up-to-date cyber threat intelligence in log analysis tools to improve detection accuracy and characterize threat actors, their methods, and indicators of compromise

DE.AE-02.292.title: Ex3
DE.AE-02.292.text: Regularly conduct manual reviews of log events for technologies that cannot be sufficiently monitored through automation

DE.AE-02.293.title: Ex4
DE.AE-02.293.text: Use log analysis tools to generate reports on their findings

DE.AE-03.text: Information is correlated from multiple sources

DE.AE-03.294.title: Ex1
DE.AE-03.294.text: Constantly transfer log data generated by other sources to a relatively small number of log servers

DE.AE-03.295.title: Ex2
DE.AE-03.295.text: Use event correlation technology (e.g., SIEM) to collect information captured by multiple sources

DE.AE-03.296.title: Ex3
DE.AE-03.296.text: Utilize cyber threat intelligence to help correlate events among log sources

DE.AE-04.text: The estimated impact and scope of adverse events are understood

DE.AE-04.297.title: Ex1
DE.AE-04.297.text: Use SIEMs or other tools to estimate impact and scope, and review and refine the estimates

DE.AE-04.298.title: Ex2
DE.AE-04.298.text: A person creates their own estimates of impact and scope

DE.AE-06.text: Information on adverse events is provided to authorized staff and tools

DE.AE-06.299.title: Ex1
DE.AE-06.299.text: Use cybersecurity software to generate alerts and provide them to the security operations center (SOC), incident responders, and incident response tools

DE.AE-06.300.title: Ex2
DE.AE-06.300.text: Incident responders and other authorized personnel can access log analysis findings at all times

DE.AE-06.301.title: Ex3
DE.AE-06.301.text: Automatically create and assign tickets in the organization's ticketing system when certain types of alerts occur

DE.AE-06.302.title: Ex4
DE.AE-06.302.text: Manually create and assign tickets in the organization's ticketing system when technical staff discover indicators of compromise

DE.AE-07.text: Cyber threat intelligence and other contextual information are integrated into the analysis

DE.AE-07.303.title: Ex1
DE.AE-07.303.text: Securely provide cyber threat intelligence feeds to detection technologies, processes, and personnel

DE.AE-07.304.title: Ex2
DE.AE-07.304.text: Securely provide information from asset inventories to detection technologies, processes, and personnel

DE.AE-07.305.title: Ex3
DE.AE-07.305.text: Rapidly acquire and analyze vulnerability disclosures for the organization's technologies from suppliers, vendors, and third-party security advisories

DE.AE-08.text: Incidents are declared when adverse events meet the defined incident criteria

DE.AE-08.306.title: Ex1
DE.AE-08.306.text: Apply incident criteria to known and assumed characteristics of activity in order to determine whether an incident should be declared

DE.AE-08.307.title: Ex2
DE.AE-08.307.text: Take known false positives into account when applying incident criteria

DE.CM.title: Continuous Monitoring
DE.CM.text: Assets are monitored to find anomalies, indicators of compromise, and other potentially adverse events

DE.CM-01.text: Networks and network services are monitored to find potentially adverse events

DE.CM-01.271.title: Ex1
DE.CM-01.271.text: Monitor DNS, BGP, and other network services for adverse events

DE.CM-01.272.title: Ex2
DE.CM-01.272.text: Monitor wired and wireless networks for connections from unauthorized endpoints

DE.CM-01.273.title: Ex3
DE.CM-01.273.text: Monitor facilities for unauthorized or rogue wireless networks

DE.CM-01.274.title: Ex4
DE.CM-01.274.text: Compare actual network flows against baselines to detect deviations

DE.CM-01.275.title: Ex5
DE.CM-01.275.text: Monitor network communications to identify changes in security postures for zero trust purposes

DE.CM-02.text: The physical environment is monitored to find potentially adverse events

DE.CM-02.276.title: Ex1
DE.CM-02.276.text: Monitor logs from physical access control systems (e.g., badge readers) to find unusual access patterns (e.g., deviations from the norm) and failed access attempts

DE.CM-02.277.title: Ex2
DE.CM-02.277.text: Review and monitor physical access records (e.g., from visitor registration, sign-in sheets)

DE.CM-02.278.title: Ex3
DE.CM-02.278.text: Monitor physical access controls (e.g., locks, latches, hinge pins, alarms) for signs of tampering

DE.CM-02.279.title: Ex4
DE.CM-02.279.text: Monitor the physical environment using alarm systems, cameras, and security guards

DE.CM-03.text: Personnel activity and technology usage are monitored to find potentially adverse events

DE.CM-03.280.title: Ex1
DE.CM-03.280.text: Use behavior analytics software to detect anomalous user activity to mitigate insider threats

DE.CM-03.281.title: Ex2
DE.CM-03.281.text: Monitor logs from logical access control systems to find unusual access patterns and failed access attempts

DE.CM-03.282.title: Ex3
DE.CM-03.282.text: Continuously monitor deception technology, including user accounts, for any usage

DE.CM-06.text: External service provider activities and services are monitored to find potentially adverse events

DE.CM-06.283.title: Ex1
DE.CM-06.283.text: Monitor remote and onsite administration and maintenance activities that external providers perform on organizational systems

DE.CM-06.284.title: Ex2
DE.CM-06.284.text: Monitor activity from cloud-based services, internet service providers, and other service providers for deviations from expected behavior

DE.CM-09.text: Computing hardware and software, runtime environments, and their data are monitored to find potentially adverse events

DE.CM-09.285.title: Ex1
DE.CM-09.285.text: Monitor email, web, file sharing, collaboration services, and other common attack vectors to detect malware, phishing, data leaks and exfiltration, and other adverse events

DE.CM-09.286.title: Ex2
DE.CM-09.286.text: Monitor authentication attempts to identify attacks against credentials and unauthorized credential reuse

DE.CM-09.287.title: Ex3
DE.CM-09.287.text: Monitor software configurations for deviations from security baselines

DE.CM-09.288.title: Ex4
DE.CM-09.288.text: Monitor hardware and software for signs of tampering

DE.CM-09.289.title: Ex5
DE.CM-09.289.text: Use technologies with a presence on endpoints to detect cyber health issues (e.g., missing patches, malware infections, unauthorized software), and redirect the endpoints to a remediation environment before access is authorized

RS.title: RESPOND
RS.text: Actions regarding a detected cybersecurity incident are taken

RS.MA.title: Incident Management
RS.MA.text: Responses to detected cybersecurity incidents are managed

RS.MA-01.text: The incident response plan is executed in coordination with relevant third parties once an incident is declared

RS.MA-01.308.title: Ex1
RS.MA-01.308.text: Detection technologies automatically report confirmed incidents

RS.MA-01.309.title: Ex2
RS.MA-01.309.text: Request incident response assistance from the organization's incident response outsourcer

RS.MA-01.310.title: Ex3
RS.MA-01.310.text: Designate an incident lead for each incident

RS.MA-01.311.title: Ex4
RS.MA-01.311.text: Initiate execution of additional cybersecurity plans as needed to support incident response (for example, business continuity and disaster recovery)

RS.MA-02.text: Incident reports are triaged and validated

RS.MA-02.312.title: Ex1
RS.MA-02.312.text: Preliminarily review incident reports to confirm that they are cybersecurity-related and necessitate incident response activities

RS.MA-02.313.title: Ex2
RS.MA-02.313.text: Apply criteria to estimate the severity of an incident

RS.MA-03.314.title: Ex1
RS.MA-03.314.text: Further review and categorize incidents based on the type of incident (e.g., data breach, ransomware, DDoS, account compromise)

RS.MA-03.315.title: Ex2
RS.MA-03.315.text: Prioritize incidents based on their scope, likely impact, and time-critical nature

RS.MA-03.316.title: Ex3
RS.MA-03.316.text: Select incident response strategies for active incidents by balancing the need to quickly recover from an incident with the need to observe the attacker or conduct a more thorough investigation

RS.MA-04.text: Incidents are escalated or elevated as needed

RS.MA-04.317.title: Ex1
RS.MA-04.317.text: Track and validate the status of all ongoing incidents

RS.MA-04.318.title: Ex2
RS.MA-04.318.text: Coordinate incident escalation or elevation with designated internal and external stakeholders

RS.MA-05.text: The criteria for initiating incident recovery are applied

RS.MA-05.319.title: Ex1
RS.MA-05.319.text: Apply incident recovery criteria to known and assumed characteristics of the incident to determine whether incident recovery processes should be initiated

RS.MA-05.320.title: Ex2
RS.MA-05.320.text: Take the possible operational disruption of incident recovery activities into account

RS.AN.title: Incident Analysis
RS.AN.text: Investigations are conducted to ensure effective response and support forensics and recovery activities

RS.AN-03.text: Analysis is performed to establish what has taken place during an incident and the root cause of the incident

RS.AN-03.321.title: Ex1
RS.AN-03.321.text: Determine the sequence of events that occurred during the incident and which assets and resources were involved in each event

RS.AN-03.322.title: Ex2
RS.AN-03.322.text: Attempt to determine what vulnerabilities, threats, and threat actors were directly or indirectly involved in the incident

RS.AN-03.323.title: Ex3
RS.AN-03.323.text: Analyze the incident to find the underlying, systemic root causes

RS.AN-03.324.title: Ex4
RS.AN-03.324.text: Check any cyber deception technology for additional information on attacker behavior

RS.AN-06.text: Actions performed during an investigation are recorded, and the records' integrity and provenance are preserved

RS.AN-06.325.title: Ex1
RS.AN-06.325.text: Require each incident responder and others (e.g., system administrators, cybersecurity engineers) who perform incident response tasks to record their actions and make the record immutable

RS.AN-06.326.title: Ex2
RS.AN-06.326.text: Require the incident lead to document the incident in detail and be responsible for preserving the integrity of the documentation and the sources of all information being reported

RS.AN-07.text: Incident data and metadata are collected, and their integrity and provenance are preserved

RS.AN-07.327.title: Ex1
RS.AN-07.327.text: Collect, preserve, and safeguard the integrity of all pertinent incident data and metadata (e.g., data source, date/time of collection) based on evidence preservation and chain-of-custody procedures

RS.AN-08.text: An incident's magnitude is estimated and validated

RS.AN-08.328.title: Ex1
RS.AN-08.328.text: Review other potential targets of the incident to search for indicators of compromise and evidence of persistence

RS.AN-08.329.title: Ex2
RS.AN-08.329.text: Automatically run tools on targets to look for indicators of compromise and evidence of persistence

RS.CO.title: Incident Response Reporting and Communication
RS.CO.text: Response activities are coordinated with internal and external stakeholders as required by laws, regulations, or policies

RS.CO-02.text: Internal and external stakeholders are notified of incidents

RS.CO-02.330.title: Ex1
RS.CO-02.330.text: Follow the organization's breach notification procedures after discovering a data breach incident, including notifying affected customers

RS.CO-02.331.title: Ex2
RS.CO-02.331.text: Notify business partners and customers of incidents in accordance with contractual requirements

RS.CO-02.332.title: Ex3
RS.CO-02.332.text: Notify law enforcement agencies and regulatory bodies of incidents based on criteria in the incident response plan and management approval

RS.CO-03.text: Information is shared with designated internal and external stakeholders

RS.CO-03.333.title: Ex1
RS.CO-03.333.text: Securely share information consistent with response plans and information sharing agreements

RS.CO-03.334.title: Ex2
RS.CO-03.334.text: Voluntarily share information about an attacker's observed TTPs, with all sensitive data removed, with an Information Sharing and Analysis Center (ISAC)

RS.CO-03.335.title: Ex3
RS.CO-03.335.text: Notify HR when malicious insider activity occurs

RS.CO-03.336.title: Ex4
RS.CO-03.336.text: Regularly update senior leadership on the status of major incidents

RS.CO-03.337.title: Ex5
RS.CO-03.337.text: Follow the rules and protocols defined in contracts for incident information sharing between the organization and its suppliers

RS.CO-03.338.title: Ex6
RS.CO-03.338.text: Coordinate crisis communication methods between the organization and its critical suppliers

RS.MI.title: Incident Mitigation
RS.MI.text: Activities are performed to prevent expansion of an event and mitigate its effects

RS.MI-01.339.title: Ex1
RS.MI-01.339.text: Cybersecurity technologies (e.g., antivirus software) and cybersecurity features of other technologies (e.g., operating systems, network infrastructure devices) automatically perform containment actions

RS.MI-01.340.title: Ex2
RS.MI-01.340.text: Allow incident responders to manually select and perform containment actions

RS.MI-01.341.title: Ex3
RS.MI-01.341.text: Allow a third party (e.g., internet service provider, managed security service provider) to perform containment actions on behalf of the organization

RS.MI-01.342.title: Ex4
RS.MI-01.342.text: Automatically transfer compromised endpoints to a remediation virtual local area network (VLAN)

RS.MI-02.343.title: Ex1
RS.MI-02.343.text: Cybersecurity technologies and cybersecurity features of other technologies (e.g., operating systems, network infrastructure devices) automatically perform eradication actions

RS.MI-02.344.title: Ex2
RS.MI-02.344.text: Allow incident responders to manually select and perform eradication actions

RS.MI-02.345.title: Ex3
RS.MI-02.345.text: Allow a third party (e.g., managed security service provider) to perform eradication actions on behalf of the organization

RC.title: RECOVER
RC.text: Assets and operations affected by a cybersecurity incident are restored

RC.RP.title: Incident Recovery Plan Execution
RC.RP.text: Restoration activities are performed to ensure operational availability of systems and services affected by cybersecurity incidents

RC.RP-01.text: The recovery portion of the incident response plan is executed once initiated from the incident response process

RC.RP-01.346.title: Ex1
RC.RP-01.346.text: Begin recovery procedures during or after incident response processes

RC.RP-01.347.title: Ex2
RC.RP-01.347.text: Make all individuals with recovery responsibilities aware of the plans for recovery and the authorizations required to implement each aspect of the plans

RC.RP-02.text: Recovery actions are selected, scoped, prioritized, and performed

RC.RP-02.348.title: Ex1
RC.RP-02.348.text: Select recovery actions based on the criteria defined in the incident response plan and available resources

RC.RP-02.349.title: Ex2
RC.RP-02.349.text: Change planned recovery actions based on a reassessment of organizational needs and resources

RC.RP-03.text: The integrity of backups and other restoration assets is verified before using them for restoration

RC.RP-03.350.title: Ex1
RC.RP-03.350.text: Check restoration assets for indicators of compromise, file corruption, and other integrity issues before use

RC.RP-04.text: Critical mission functions and cybersecurity risk management are considered to establish post-incident operational norms

RC.RP-04.351.title: Ex1
RC.RP-04.351.text: Use business impact and system categorization records (including service delivery objectives) to validate that essential services are restored in the appropriate order

RC.RP-04.352.title: Ex2
RC.RP-04.352.text: Work with system owners to confirm the successful restoration of systems and the return to normal operations

RC.RP-04.353.title: Ex3
RC.RP-04.353.text: Monitor the performance of restored systems to verify the adequacy of the restoration

RC.RP-05.text: The integrity of restored assets is verified, systems and services are restored, and normal operating status is confirmed

RC.RP-05.354.title: Ex1
RC.RP-05.354.text: Check restored assets for indicators of compromise and remediation of root causes of the incident before production use

RC.RP-05.355.title: Ex2
RC.RP-05.355.text: Verify the correctness and adequacy of the restoration actions taken before putting a restored system online

RC.RP-06.text: The end of incident recovery is declared based on criteria, and incident-related documentation is completed

RC.RP-06.356.title: Ex1
RC.RP-06.356.text: Prepare an after-action report that documents the incident itself, the response and recovery actions taken, and lessons learned

RC.RP-06.357.title: Ex2
RC.RP-06.357.text: Declare the end of incident recovery once the criteria are met

RC.CO.title: Incident Recovery Communication
RC.CO.text: Restoration activities are coordinated with internal and external parties

RC.CO-03.text: Recovery activities and progress in restoring operational capabilities are communicated to designated internal and external stakeholders

RC.CO-03.358.title: Ex1
RC.CO-03.358.text: Securely share recovery information, including restoration progress, consistent with response plans and information sharing agreements

RC.CO-03.359.title: Ex2
RC.CO-03.359.text: Regularly update senior leadership on recovery status and restoration progress for major incidents

RC.CO-03.360.title: Ex3
RC.CO-03.360.text: Follow the rules and protocols defined in contracts for incident information sharing between the organization and its suppliers

RC.CO-03.361.title: Ex4
RC.CO-03.361.text: Coordinate crisis communication between the organization and its critical suppliers

RC.CO-04.text: Public updates on incident recovery are shared using approved methods and messaging

RC.CO-04.362.title: Ex1
RC.CO-04.362.text: Follow the organization's breach notification procedures for recovering from a data breach incident

RC.CO-04.363.title: Ex2
RC.CO-04.363.text: Explain the steps being taken to recover from the incident and to prevent a recurrence
